official-title.#text: To authorize the conveyance of two small parcels of land within the boundaries of the Coconino National Forest containing private improvements that were developed based upon the reliance of the landowners in an erroneous survey conducted in May 1960.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives June 17, 2013.

header.#text: Conveyance of land to correct erroneous survey, Coconino National Forest, Arizona

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may convey by quitclaim deed all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the two parcels of land described in

to a person or legal entity that represents (by power of attorney) the majority of landowners with private property adjacent to the two parcels. These parcels are within the boundaries of the Coconino National Forest and contain private improvements that were developed based upon the reliance of the landowners in an erroneous survey conducted in May 1960.
consist of approximately 2.67 acres described in the
’s Survey Plat titled Subdivision and Metes and Bounds Surveys in secs. 28 and 29, T. 20 N., R. 7 E., Gila and Salt River Meridian, approved February 2, 2010, as follows:

text.#text: The two parcels of land authorized for conveyance under
Lot 2, sec. 28, T. 20 N., R. 7 E., Gila and Salt River Meridian, Coconino County, Arizona.
Lot 1, sec. 29, T. 20 N., R. 7 E., Gila and Salt River Meridian, Coconino County, Arizona.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the person or legal entity that represents (by power of attorney) the majority of landowners with private property adjacent to the parcels shall pay to the Secretary consideration in the amount of $20,000.

text.#text: As consideration for the conveyance of the two parcels under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall deposit the consideration received under this subsection in a special account in the fund established under
, without further appropriation and until expended, for acquisition of land in the

text.#text: The deposited funds shall be available to the
Any public orders withdrawing any of the Federal land from appropriation or disposal under the public land laws are revoked to the extent necessary to permit conveyance of the Federal land under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is withdrawn from all forms of entry and appropriation under the public land laws, location, entry, and patent under the mining laws, and operation of the mineral leasing and geothermal leasing laws until the date which the conveyance is completed.

text.#text: Subject to valid existing rights, the Federal land authorized for conveyance under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be subject only to those surveys and clearances as needed to protect the interests of the United States.

text.#text: The authority provided under this section shall terminate three years after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 862 EH: To authorize the conveyance of two small parcels of land within the boundaries of the Coconino National Forest containing private improvements that were developed based upon the reliance of the landowners in an erroneous survey conducted in May 1960.
